intro: Oreocosmus ghiesbreghtii, commonly known as the Ghiesbreght's rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
